verses.verse: (The Confidence of the Foolish) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. [1] Hear this, all peoples; Give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
Both low and high, Rich and poor together.
My mouth shall speak wisdom, And the meditation of my heart shall give understanding.
I will incline my ear to a proverb; I will disclose my dark saying on the harp.
Why should I fear in the days of evil, When the iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
Those who (Job 31:24; Ps. 52:7; (Prov. 11:28; Mark 10:23, 24)) trust in their wealth And boast in the multitude of their riches,
None of them can by any means redeem his brother, Nor (Job 36:18, 19) give to God a ransom for him—
For ((Matt. 16:26)) the redemption of their souls is costly, And it shall cease forever—
That he should continue to live eternally, And (Ps. 89:48) not see the Pit.
For he sees wise men die; Likewise the fool and the senseless person perish, And leave their wealth to others.
Their inner thought is that their houses will last forever, Their dwelling places to all generations; They (Gen. 4:17; Deut. 3:14) call their lands after their own names.
Nevertheless man, though in honor, does not remain; He is like the beasts that perish.
This is the way of those who are ((Luke 12:20)) foolish, And of their posterity who approve their sayings. Selah

Like sheep they are laid in the grave; Death shall feed on them; (Ps. 47:3; (Dan. 7:18; 1 Cor. 6:2; Rev. 2:26)) The upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; (Job 4:21) And their beauty shall be consumed in the grave, far from their dwelling.
But God ((Hos. 13:4); Mark 16:6, 7; Acts 2:31, 32) will redeem my soul from the power of the grave, For He shall (Ps. 73:24) receive me. Selah
Do not be afraid when one becomes rich, When the glory of his house is increased;
For when he dies he shall carry nothing away; His glory shall not descend after him.
Though while he lives (Deut. 29:19; Luke 12:19) he blesses himself (For men will praise you when you do well for yourself),
He shall go to the generation of his fathers; They shall never see (Job 33:30) light.
A man who is in honor, yet does not understand, (Eccl. 3:19) Is like the beasts that perish.
